###TIME SERIES - FINANCIAL DATA:
<br>

From this [R-bloggers](http://programming-r-pro-bro.blogspot.com/2013/04/forecasting-stock-returns-using-arima.html).

```{R, warning=F, message=F}
library(quantmod)
library(tseries)
library(forecast)
getSymbols("GOOG")
```

```{r}
d = GOOG$GOOG.Adjusted
summary(d)
head(d)
plot(d)

adf.test(d) # Not stationary. We will difference and log.
```


```{r}
GOOG = 100 * diff(log(d))[-1]
head(GOOG)
adf.test(GOOG) # Now it is stationary.


#We can fit a model using the [Yule-Walker equations](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AR_model#Calculation_of_the_AR_parameters)

summary(arma(GOOG, order = c(2,2)))

train = GOOG[1 : (0.9 * length(GOOG))]
test  = GOOG[(0.9 * length(GOOG) + 1):  length(GOOG)]

fit = arima(train, order = c(2, 0, 2))

predi = predict(fit, n.ahead = (length(GOOG) - (0.9*length(GOOG))))$pred
fore  = forecast(fit, h = 25)

plot(fore)
accuracy(predi, test)[2]
```
